Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2012 12:53AM Iwillwinthisbattle wrote: Such a tough subject! Here's how I see it....no one is to blame, not me, not God, not anyone. I have/had stage 4 cancer. I am now NED. It is/was what it is/was. I could not be anymore thankful than I am that I will be here to watch my kids grow for at least a little while longer. Here is what I know. My ONLY thought when I was first diagnosed was, how can I get through this so I can raise my kids? They were adopted and had already "lost" one Mom. I couldn't let them lose another. Second...I knew that when I was upset/worried, I caused physiological changes in my body. Upset stomach, increased heart rate, etc. so.......why couldn't I cause positive changes in my body with positive thoughts? It couldn't hurt. I don't have the answers, but I choose to take a positive outlook for as long as I am able. Enough with awareness, it's time for a cure!!!! .
